Dear Ms. Prudhomme:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Barbara A Cote, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4150 Incident Reporting.
Section (3) If an institution determines that a youth is absent without legal
Description permission, then the institution shall immediately report the
information to law enforcement, the parent/ legal guardian or next
of kin, the licensing authority, and the referring agency.
(4) When a resident’s behavior results in contact with law
enforcement, the incident shall be reported to the parent/legal
guardian, responsible referring agency, and the licensing authority
as soon as possible, but not more than 24 hours after the incident.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Facility did not notify DCWL of two youth going AWOL and law
enforcement being on campus.
Investigation Interviews:
The complainant is this consultant as consultant was made
aware on April 4, 2023, by Director of Quality Compliance that
two youth went AWOL on April 1, 2023 and law enforcement
was at the facility. Director of Quality Compliance reported this
Consultant was not notified of these incidents.
Director of Quality Compliance was interviewed face to face
at the facility on April 4, 2023. Director of Quality Compliance
stated information of the two youth going AWOL and law
enforcement being at the facility on April 1, 2023 failed to get
relayed to this Consultant.
Documents Reviewed:
• Eagle Village Incident Report dated 04/03/2023 describing
two youth going AWOL and law enforcement being at the
facility.
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance as the licensing authority
was not notified of two youth being AWOL and a youth’s behavior
resulting in law enforcement being at the facility on April 1, 2023.
The licensing authority was not notified of these incidents until
April 4, 2023.
Conclusion Violation Established
2

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
